question: Which international organisation has launched the “Alliance for Poverty Eradication”, amid COVID-19 pandemic?
explanation:
The United Nations has launched the “Alliance for Poverty Eradication”. India has recently become a founding member of the Alliance.
The President of the 74th Session of the UN General Assembly Tijjani Muhammad-Bande announced the alliance in an informal meeting. He will formally launch the 'Alliance for Poverty Eradication' on June 30, which aims to provide a platform for member states to boost global economy after the effects of COVID-19 pandemic.
